page.title: 06The Church,Stoke-by-Clare :2
page.content:
Over the arches on each side of the nave there is a clerestory of five large windows.Some of the old pews with carved poppy-head finials remain in the chancel and south aisle. The pulpit,a gift of Matthew Parker, dates from the 15th century and is believed to be the smallest in England.
There are many other notable features:murals,brasses and memorials. One of these is in memory of Matthew Parker,Rector of the Parish,Dean of Stoke College and Archbishop of Canterbury,who died 1575.
